intro: Herderia somalensis, commonly known as the Somali herderia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and can withstand periods of drought. It typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters and produces white or pale yellow blooms during the dry season. Herderia somalensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its harsh environment.
